Package parallel.distributed

Extends the basic functionality found in the parallel package over many remote JVMs distributed over a network of machines.

See:
          Description

Interface Summary
DMsgIntf DMsgIntf objects are meant to transport over Socket wires sendData() and/or recvData() requests, as those are defined in the parallel.MsgPassingCoordinator class, which is in fact the class used to "transfer" message data between the threads in the parallel.distributed.DMsgPassingCoordinatorSrv class.
 

Class Summary
DAccMsg DAccMsg objects are meant to transport over Socket wires number accumulation requests (accumulate-data or get[Min/Max/Sum...] requests).
DAccumulatorClt class implementing clients for sending accumulating numbers between threads living in distributed JVMs (or for asking the current min/max/sum value among the received numbers).
DAccumulatorSrv class implements a server for distributed data accumulation functionality.
DActiveMsgPassingCoordinatorLongLivedConnClt class implementing clients for message-passing between threads living in distributed JVMs.
DActiveMsgPassingCoordinatorLongLivedConnSrv server class implementing distributed Message-Passing between inter-process (and intra-process) threads.
DActiveMsgPassingLongLivedConnTest test for the DActiveMsgPassingCoordinatorLongLivedConn[Clt/Srv] classes.
DBarrier class implements a distributed barrier object across many threads living in many (remote) JVMs.
DBarrierAddRequest implements a DMsgIntf object that asks a DBarrierSrv to add the corresponding thread to its pool of participants in the DBarrier.
DBarrierRequest implements a request to enter the barrier state.
DBarrierRmRequest class implementing a DBarrier Remove Request for the associated thread that called the relevant DBarrier.removeCurrentThread() method.
DBarrierSrv class implements a server for distributed barrier functionality.
DBarrierTest test-driver for the DBarrier class.
DConditionCounter wrapper singleton class for ConditionCounter objects.
DConditionCounterAwaitRequest implements a DMsgIntf object that asks a DConditionCounterSrv to await its associated ConditionCounter until it reaches zero.
DConditionCounterClt class implements a distributed parallel.ConditionCounter across many threads living in many (remote) JVMs.
DConditionCounterDecrRequest implements a DMsgIntf object that asks a DConditionCounterSrv to decrement its associated ConditionCounter.
DConditionCounterIncrRequest implements a DMsgIntf object that asks a DConditionCounterSrv to increment its associated ConditionCounter.
DConditionCounterLLCClt Same functionality as DConditionCounter[Clt|Srv] classes, but use long-lived connections, for clients that call frequently incr/decr ops.
DConditionCounterLLCSrv Same functionality as DConditionCounter[Clt|Srv] classes, but use long-lived connections, for clients that call frequently incr/decr ops.
DConditionCounterResetRequest implements a DMsgIntf object that asks a DConditionCounterSrv to reset its associated ConditionCounter.
DConditionCounterShutDownRequest implements a DMsgIntf object that asks a DConditionCounterSrv to shut-down.
DConditionCounterSrv class implements a server for distributed condition-counter functionality.
DFileAccessSrvStatsRequest class encapsulates request to return statistics about the server cache for a specific file being read.
DFileDataVectorReadRequest class encapsulates request to read from a file residing on a machine running a msg-passing coordinator server, a certain range of vectors.
DLock implements a distributed lock, valid across JVMs and across multiple threads in each JVM.
DLockSrv class implements a server for distributed locking functionality.
DLockTest tests the DLock class methods.
DMsgPassingCoordinatorClt class implementing clients for message-passing between threads living in distributed JVMs.
DMsgPassingCoordinatorSrv server class implementing distributed Message-Passing between inter-process (and intra-process) threads.
DMsgPassingTest test for the DMsgPassingCoordinator[Clt/Srv] classes.
DRecvMsg implements a wrapper object for a "recvData()" request from a (local/remote) thread that is transmitted via the socket wire to the parallel.distributed.DMsgPassingCoordinatorSrv.
DReduceAddRequest implements a DMsgIntf object that asks a DReduceSrv to add the corresponding thread to its pool of participants in the DReducer.
DReducer class implements a distributed reducer object across many threads living in many (remote) JVMs.
DReduceRequest implements a request to enter a distributed reduce operation.
DReduceRmRequest class implementing a DReducer Remove Request for the associated thread that called the relevant DReducer.removeCurrentThread() method.
DReduceSrv class implements a server for distributed reduce functionality.
DRLockGetRequest implements a DMsgIntf object that asks a DRWLockSrv identified by name to get to the current thread a global read-lock.
DRLockReleaseRequest implements a DMsgIntf object that asks a DRWLockSrv identified by name to release from the current thread a global read-lock.
DRWLock class implements a distributed read-write lock object across many threads living in many (remote) JVMs.
DRWLockSrv class implements a server for distributed read-write locking functionality.
DSendMsg implements a wrapper object for a "sendData()" request from a (local/remote) thread that is transmitted via the socket wire to the parallel.distributed.DMsgPassingCoordinatorSrv.
DWLockGetRequest implements a DMsgIntf object that asks a DRWLockSrv identified by name to get to the current thread a global write-lock.
DWLockReleaseRequest implements a DMsgIntf object that asks a DRWLockSrv identified by name to release from the current thread a global write-lock.
FailedReply indicates to remote client a failure in a previous request.
FwdSrv class implements a forwarding server.
LockIfAvailableRequest indicates a request for a distributed lock if one can be given immediately, with no waiting.
LockNotAvailableNowResponse indicates a response that a distributed lock canNOT be given immediately, with no waiting.
OKReply indicates an "OK" response to a previous request.
OKReplyData helper class not part of the public API.
PDAsynchBatchTaskExecutorClt class implements the "Client" for networks of PDAsynchBatchTaskExecutorWrk workers attached to PDAsynchBatchTaskExecutorSrv servers (managers really), as a Singleton.
PDAsynchBatchTaskExecutorCltTest test-driver for PDAsynchBatchTaskExecutorClt and networks of PDAsynchBatchTaskExecutorWrk objects in general.
PDAsynchBatchTaskExecutorSrv Server class allows clients or workers to connect to this process and submit TaskObjects for asynchronous processing to any of the available workers in the network of connected workers.
PDAsynchBatchTaskExecutorWrk class implements a worker process, that is capable of accepting (through network sockets) arrays of TaskObjects and executes them using a parallel.FasterParallelAsynchBatchTaskExecutor.
PDAsynchInitCmd empty abstract class extends RRObject.
PDAsynchNoOpInitCmd no-op initialization command for PDAsynchBatchTaskExecutor[Clt|Srv|Wrk] objects.
PDBatchTaskExecutor Class implements thread-pooling to allow its users to execute concurrently a batch of tasks implementing the TaskObject interface.
PDBatchTaskExecutorClt class implements the "Client" for networks of PDBatchTaskExecutorWrk workers.
PDBatchTaskExecutorCltTest test-driver for PDBatchTaskExecutorClt and networks of PDBatchTaskExecutorWrk objects in general.
PDBatchTaskExecutorCltTest2 test-driver for PDBatchTaskExecutorClt and networks of PDBatchTaskExecutorWrk objects in general.
PDBatchTaskExecutorSrv Server class allows clients or workers to connect to this process and submit TaskObjects for processing to any of the available workers in the network of connected workers.
PDBatchTaskExecutorWrk class implements a worker process, that is capable of accepting (through network sockets) arrays of TaskObjects and executes them using a parallel.distributed.PDBatchTaskExecutor.
PDBTETest  
PDBTExecInitedClt thread-safe class implements the "Client" for networks of PDBTExecInitedWrk workers.
PDBTExecInitedCltTest test-driver for PDBTExecInitedClt and networks of PDBTExecInitedWrk objects in general.
PDBTExecInitedSrv class extends the PDBatchTaskExecutorSrv class to allow a load-balancing distributed computing architecture, whereby a server object of this class can only have many clients connected to it, and no other known servers connected to it at all.
PDBTExecInitedWrk class implements a worker process, that is capable of accepting (through network sockets) arrays of TaskObjects and executes them using a parallel.distributed.PDBatchTaskExecutor.
PDBTExecInitNoOpCmd no-op initialization command for PDBTExecInited[Clt|Srv|Wrk] objects.
PDBTExecSingleCltWrkInitSrv class extends the PDBatchTaskExecutorSrv class to allow a load-balancing distributed computing architecture, whereby a server object of this class can only have a single client connected to it, and no other known servers connected to it at all.
RRObject auxiliary base-class wrapping up Requests/Results for TaskObjects processing.
SimpleMessage encapsulates a single String object.
 

Exception Summary
PDAsynchBatchTaskExecutorException indicates an exception in the execution of a task collection in a remote PDAsynchBatchTaskExecutor[Wrk].
PDBatchTaskExecutorException indicates an exception in the execution of a task collection in a remote PDBatchTaskExecutor[Wrk].
 

Package parallel.distributed Description

Extends the basic functionality found in the parallel package over many remote JVMs distributed over a network of machines.

Package Specification

The package contains algorithms for obtaining distributed locks, barriers, Parallel-Distributed (Synchronous or Asynchronous) Task Executors, and Message Passing Coordinators, over standard socket mechanisms (transport layer in the OSI stack), without using RMI or web-services technologies. For more details, read the documentation for each class. Each class comes with a test-driver program that show-cases its intended use and effects. The whole package makes heavy use of the parallel package and its classes. Notice that this package does not use secure socket layer communications; it assumes that the whole network of machines that will host the package's servers is in essentially a demilitarized zone (behind fire-walls, in appropriate domains etc.) Also notice that this package has several servers that can combine to scale far beyond O/S imposed limitations on the number of concurrent threads or sockets that a system may have open at any time, via the use of aggregators; for example, several DLockSrv servers may combine (by pointing to another, central DLockSrv) to allow for many more concurrent open lock requests than a single server can allow. Similarly, see the design for PD[Asynch]BatchTaskExecutor[Clt/Srv/Wrk] to see how networks or rings of servers can form, to each of which many more workers or clients may be connected than could in any single server.
